citations.narrative:
In 4 outdoor enclosures containing a total of 26 birds, heat lamps with exposed lamp bulbs were plugged in and placed in
locations where the occupants could have direct contact with them. An enclosure with vultures, another with an Eagle, the
last 2 which contained a combination of ibis, pigeons and ducks. This could lead to potential injury if the bird were to make
contact with the bulbs when hot or damage the bulbs. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that
they protect the birds from injury.
Correct by: 05/28/2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a documented environment enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their avian
species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan
for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by
the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special
considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently accepted professional
standards.
Correct by: 05/15/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In 4 outdoor enclosures containing a total of 26 birds, heat lamps with exposed lamp bulbs were plugged in and placed in 
locations where the occupants could have direct contact with them. An enclosure with vultures, another with an Eagle, the 
last 2 which contained a combination of ibis, pigeons and ducks. This could lead to potential injury if the bird were to make 
contact with the bulbs when hot or damage the bulbs. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that 
they protect the birds from injury.  
Correct by: 05/28/2024 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility did not have a documented environment enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their avian 
species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan 
for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by 
the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special 
considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently accepted professional 
standards. 
Correct by: 05/15/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
